channel.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
channel.description:
I got bored and tried something i have never done before, and i made the 99 bottles of beer song. Lol attached if your bored.
[img]http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/308/99ub0.png[/img]
ints are pretty fun too fool with ;D

item.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:143395”][quote author=yakman link=topic=196700.msg1758360#msg1758360 date=1189895646]

They crushed your spirit?

yeah, the poor guy got the piss ripped out of him
[/quote]
I can’t say I blame people for doing it to him, seeing as most of the code is for the GUI (which is generated by the IDE, not written by him). He writes maybe 5 lines of code, and calls it software, and still wonders why people have a go at him.[/quote]
I just wanted it to look better than just outprints. I actually did try it without the IDE first, but i was having trouble remembering on using borderlayout correctly, So now i do know.

Read full topic
item.source: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great

item.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

heres mine

class Beer { private static int BEERBOTTLES = 99; public static void main(String... args) { while(BEERBOTTLES > 0) { System.out.println(BEERBOTTLES + " bottle" + ((BEERBOTTLES > 1) ? "s" : "") + " of beer on the wall,\n" + BEERBOTTLES + " bottle" + ((BEERBOTTLES > 1) ? "s" : "") + " of beer.\nTake one down, pass it around,\n" + (((BEERBOTTLES = BEERBOTTLES - 1) != 0) ? BEERBOTTLES + " more bottle" + ((BEERBOTTLES > 1) ? "s" : "") + " of beer on the wall.\n" : "no more bottles of beer on the wall :(.")); } } }

who said moparisthebest.com quick reply box isnt a good text-editor

Read full topic
item.source: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great

item.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Yz85Racer:

They crushed your spirit?

yeah, the poor guy got the piss ripped out of him
IMO, his problem is not that he doesnt know, there are loads who dont, they learn
I think his problem is that he posts his projects, when i was learning like him, i always kept them to myself, i think he should too.

and i didnt actually mean Robot, although that would probably work, i meant using bcel, deobs or a classfile editor and making fake key events, theres a few examples floating around, like a simple hp announcer bot which loads of people updated (including me), they all have to type somehow

Read full topic

item.source: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great

item.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:4, topic:143395”]Which bit did you actually write? I know you didn’t write the init method - netbeans takes care of that. You didn’t do the main method either.

I take it this is yours, though:

[code] private void jButton1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
start();
}
public void start() {

      for (int v = 99; v > 0; v--) { 
          
      
           jTextArea1.append(v + " Bottles of  on the wall, "+ v +" Bottles of !\nTake one down pass it around "+ (v-1) +" bottles of  on the wall!\n");
          
              
          }           
                   
           
      
      
}[/code]

Nice work - maybe you’ll start experimenting with longs in a month or so. Oh, and uhh, nice identifiers.

What will our young GUI specialist think of next? :rolleyes:[/quote]
Lol, i know its not great, but I didnt know what to do at first so i looked on the java tutorials and looked at one, I didnt want to copy it, I tried to understand what it meant before i actually did it.

But if i make more threads i wont spam this section, ill just change this one

Yea i used netbeans just to make the background etc, then wrote the method. A while ago a few people on here crushed my spirit and i stopped for about a month, and i didnt remember many things.

[quote=“yakman, post:8, topic:143395”]why not make a client that does the same thing, spam out that song for all of rs to hear
i remember making the same thing in scar a while ago (Ron’s idea)[/quote]

I was looking on the docs for java robot yesterday it sounded pretty cool, If thats what your thinking, Like a bot auto talker?

Read full topic
item.source: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great

item.title: My first 99 bottles, Not soo great
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

White Castle:

[quote author=Lothy link=topic=196700.msg1757466#msg1757466 date=1189848895]Nice work - maybe you’ll start experimenting with longs in a month or so.

Didn’t anyone else catch that juicy bit of sarcasm?[/quote]
Yes, but apparently the rest are too inferior in their brain power to understand some things.

I only use Netbeans to make really, really big complex GUIs which i cba with. However it pisses me off when I have to port everything over to Idea. I avoid when possible, although I must admit the “free design” in netbeans is awesome. If anyone knows a similar GUI builder --> Point me to it

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Which bit did you actually write? I know you didn’t write the init method - netbeans takes care of that. You didn’t do the main method either.

I take it this is yours, though:

[code] private void jButton1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
start();
}
public void start() {

      for (int v = 99; v > 0; v--) { 
          
      
           jTextArea1.append(v + " Bottles of  on the wall, "+ v +" Bottles of !\nTake one down pass it around "+ (v-1) +" bottles of  on the wall!\n");
          
              
          }           
                   
           
      
      
}[/code]

Nice work - maybe you’ll start experimenting with longs in a month or so. Oh, and uhh, nice identifiers.

What will our young GUI specialist think of next? :rolleyes:
